Speaker: ﻿Lord Croft
Text: What makes someone reach beyond the boundaries of human experience to face the unknown? As children, we question the world around us. We learn, we accept, and gradually we lose our capacity far wander. But some do not... the explorers, the seekers of truth. It is these pioneers who define the future of mankind.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: The others... They're done. No amount of money is gonna get them through those mountains.

Speaker: Lara
Text: The lost city is up there, somewhere.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: That's gonna be a hell of a climb.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm not turning back.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: I know.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You should stay here with them.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Not a chance. You're almost there... Wait till you see this VIEW. Lara! Take my hand!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Thanks... Look at that...

Speaker: Jonah
Text: It's amazing... but the snow coming off those peaks is a bad sign.

Speaker: Lara
Text: The trail leads up the mountain. We'll have a good view of the valley beyond from the summit.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: All right, let's take it easy here. This wind is crazy!

Speaker: Lara
Text: We just need to keep moving.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Hey... even if we don't find anything up here, your dad would be proud.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I know. But I have a good feeling about this. Whoa, shit!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Are you okay?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Lost my footing. I'm fine! Ahhhhh!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: No! Lara!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn, that was close...

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Lara! Are you all right?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah! I'm here!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: I'll climb down there and get you...

Speaker: Lara
Text: No! It's too dangerous! I can climb back up!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Are you sure?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Just stay put! I need to jump across.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Yeah, okay... now grab my hand! Gotcha! Shit Lara. You're gonna give me a heart attack. Are you okay?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Yeah...

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Come on... Looks like we gotta go through. No bad. If the weather turns, we can hole up in this cave. Do you really think we'll find this lost city?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I know this is a long shot. But that old tracker said he saw ruins up in these mountains.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Well, I guess if I was going to hide a lost city, this might be the kind of godforsaken place I'd do it. What do you think?

Speaker: Lara
Text: We're close to something, Jonah. I can feel it. Just this last stretch to the top.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: All right. Let's see what's up there. Feels pretty solid here, but keep close to the wall.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Okay... Looks like we climb from here.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Keep your eyes open for falling ice.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Right... you ready?

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Let's do it. Whoa! There's lots of loose ice up here.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Let's take it slow and steady. Just stay with me.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Look out!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh shit!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: That was close!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh no... Jonah... hold on!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Shit! I'm gonna dig in! Can you make it across?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can make it! Whoa!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Holy shit! I don't think I can make that jump!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Stay there, I'll anchor a line for you at the top!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: All right. I'll give you some slack! Almost there. Lara. You get it!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah! We made it! I see the ruins! Oh god!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Lara! Oh shit. I gotcha! I gotcha! Lara! can you hear me!?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: I'm going to pull you back up! ...Oh fuck!

Speaker: Lara
Text: There, over there! Quick! Swing me to the other side... Okay... here goes.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Come on, Lara.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Aaarghhh!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Lara! I can't hold you! The rope is slipping! Climb! Climb! Oh shit... move, goddamn it!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Go back, Jonah! Get to shelter!

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: It is the greatest cruelty of life... that we are all too swiftly taken from it. We age, we decay we die... but what do we leave behind? Bones? Dust? What of the soul? Does it endure beyond our earthly existence? I believe it does. A truth lies at the heart of many myths and stories. A truth not of science, but something more profound, the key to unlocking everlasting life. I may have found the next piece to the puzzle. I’m not alone in this search. They're following me, watching my every step. I know them by name now. Trinity. An ancient, violent sect with designs on controlling the future of humanity. I must proceed carefully for the sake of my family. If anything were to ever happen to Lara... or Ana, I could never forgive myself.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Lara?! It's me.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Ana! Oh god... I'm so sorry. What are you doing here?

Speaker: Ana
Text: I saw the gutter press was attacking you again. What are you doing here? I thought you could use some company.

Speaker: Lara
Text: More lies. Were you followed?

Speaker: Ana
Text: Followed? Of course not. What's going on?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I think I found the tomb.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Oh, you can't be serious.

Speaker: Lara
Text: The myth of the prophet is real. Dad was right.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Lara, your father was... unwell.

Speaker: Lara
Text: No, he was close to a great discovery, tangible evidence of the immortal soul.

Speaker: Ana
Text: I loved Richard. I would have married him if he'd asked. But he was a broken man. I don't want to see you end up like him.

Speaker: Lara
Text: But Ana, he was right. It was everyone else who was wrong. The tomb's in Syria.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Syria!?

Speaker: Ana
Text: Oh God, Lara. No. This IS madness! Get your life sorted. Go home to the manor.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You know I can't go back there.

Speaker: Ana
Text: But this obsession ruined your father.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I saw something... something I... I can't explain. Now I understand what Dad was going through.

Speaker: Ana
Text: It's all fairytales. Nonsense. Don't go down this road.

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's the only thing that makes sense to me now. I'm going to find the prophet's tomb, Ana...
[We're moving to Syria. Lara, following the GPS transmitter, hires a driver. On the way to the marked point...]

Speaker: Driver
Text: Hey. We're heading into a war zone now. You better be sure about this.

Speaker: Lara
Text: We're close. There should be an oasis in the canyon just ahead.

Speaker: Driver
Text: You're wasting your time. There's nothing out here.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Just keep driving, please.

Speaker: Driver
Text: It's your money.
[There's a helicopter in the sky.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Something isn't right...

Speaker: Driver
Text: Uhh, that's just... local militia.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You told someone, didn't you?

Speaker: Driver
Text: They... they paid better than you.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You bast...

Speaker: Driver
Text: Damn, this road...! Shit! They weren't supposed to shoot at us!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Get us out of here!

Speaker: Driver
Text: Shit... shit! Oh no, no. No!
[One of the bullets hits the driver. Lara grabbing the wheel.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: No, no, no...!
[The car's flipping over.]

[Lara wakes up and struggles to get out of the burning car. After that the car explodes and Lara is thrown into the abyss, although she manages to slow down the fall with a climbing pick. When she lands, she's hitting her head hard.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: No turning back... it has to be here...

Speaker: Lara
Text: There was something in dad's research about this.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: It was said the Prophet's Tomb was hidden in the cliffs above one of the forgotten cities. Legend speaks of an oasis where the Prophet was laid to rest.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Something's here! Could this really be it?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Incredible... It's some kind of marker... I can't quite make out the translation... But this word... <whispering> Prophet! This is it... Dad was right.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Okay, he's shown here... performing healing miracles. Dad's notes mentioned this.

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's the Prophet, speaking with a foreign army... He convinced them to lay down their weapons.

Speaker: Lara
Text: These are the miracles of the Prophet of Constantinople, unjustly murdered by Order of... Trinity.

Speaker: Lara
Text: My Greek is still a little rusty, but... it's pointing to something hidden nearby. I'll mark down the locations...

Speaker: Lara
Text: He led his followers through the desert... to the oasis...

Speaker: Solder
Text: Still no sign of her. I don't think she survived the crash.

Speaker: Lara
Text: All right, let's go. Konstantin wants to breach the tomb before sundown. They're after the tomb... I've got to find it before them!

Speaker: Lara
Text: A secret entrance...

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's amazing... if only Dad could have seen this...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh no... They're already here. Got to get inside...

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: The Order of Trinity pursued the Prophet and his people relentlessly, until finally confronting them in their hidden oasis.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn it... come on!

Speaker: Lara
Text: There was a battle here... Armed soldiers... against religious pilgrims... The Order of Trinity.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn it... that was too close.

Speaker: Lara
Text: They're blasting their way in...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Let's hope this works...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Stunning... we made it, Dad.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn! They're almost inside!

Speaker: Lara
Text: ...Found you! Empty! It's empty. No, no. What did I miss?

Speaker: Commander
Text: Set the charges. The Prophet's tomb... After all this time.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: The artifact?

Speaker: Commander
Text: Inside. God willing. Open it. Carefully. It could be extremely dangerous.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: Commander
Text: You're a smart woman. I suspect you already know.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Trinity.

Speaker: Commander
Text: Where is the artifact?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Speaker: Commander
Text: Don't play games with me. You led us to this place.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Look, it was empty when I got here. There was nobody and definitely no artifact.

Speaker: Commander
Text: Get down! Move, damn it, MOVE!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Almost... there...

Speaker: Lara
Text: What's this?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Lara!

Speaker: Lara
Text: There's so much I need to tell you. I don't-

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Did you find the prophet's tomb?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Yes, but I was followed.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: What? By who?

Speaker: Lara
Text: They call themselves Trinity. They tried to kill me.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: What the hell is going on here? You're starting to scare me.

Speaker: Lara
Text: The tomb was empty, but I think they were looking for the Divine Source.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: The artifact your father was after?

Speaker: Lara
Text: There's more. I found this symbol in the tomb. I knew I'd seen it before. It was driving me insane! That's when it hit me. I saw it here, in one of Dad's books. Listen to this. The lost city of Kitezh. Said to have disappeared in Siberia sometime in the 12th century. Legend says that on the eve of the invasion by the Mongol horde, it sunk beneath a lake.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: What does this have to do with the Prophet's artifact?

Speaker: Lara
Text: The same symbol.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: <laughing> Lara...

Speaker: Lara
Text: If the Divine Source is hidden in the ruins of Kitezh, waiting to be found, then I have to go.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: To Siberia? Are you kidding me?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Just think! If this thing could really unlock the secret of immortality, it would change everything. Sickness, suffering, death... gone!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Are you listening to yourself?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah, we've been through so much together. You know there's more out there - this could be real!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: I don't care if it's real! I've lost too many friends. I don't want to lose you too.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Dad never made the connection to Kitezh. He gave up everything for this.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Including you! Stop blaming yourself for what happened. He made his own bed.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can't give up on him. Not now. It's all I have.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: No, it isn't! If you stayed still for five minutes, maybe you'd see that!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn it!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah...?

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Lara... Holy shit!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Stop! Drop the book!

Speaker: Thug
Text: You can't stop us!

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Shit. Lara... What are we gonna do?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I led them to it, Jonah. If the Divine Source is real, we've got to find it first.

Speaker: Jonah
Text: Siberia it is, then...

Speaker: Lara
Text: <gasping for breath>

Speaker: Jonah
Text: <via radio> Lara, are you there? I’ve made it to the shelter.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jonah? Jonah, if you can hear me... Go back. Please don't try to find me. I need to do this alone. Got to find shelter.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Keep moving. Come on... you can do this... Move.

Speaker: Lara
Text: An old camp... Okay... Okay... got to start a fire... Okay... this might work. Not enough to... last the night. Need to gather more. Dry enough to burn... I hope... Fresh kill... no meat but... maybe something else I can use... Back to camp... Move, damn it.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: ...men are scouring the rains in the mountains. If the artifact is here, we’ll find it.

Speaker: Mysterious Voice
Text: And what of the Remnant?

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: They continue to resist us. But we’ll have the situation in hand soon enough.

Speaker: Mysterious Voice
Text: Good. Trinity has faith in you.

Speaker: Lara
Text: <whispering> Trinity... Going to need a stronger bow.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I wish this pain wasn't so familiar. Like looking an old enemy in the eye. It wants to take me down. It wants me to just lie down and die. But I won't. I can't. There's something here, there must be or Trinity wouldn't be in this snowy hell.

Speaker: Lara
Text: These ruins here... Mongolian...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Trinity... They're here.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh shit!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh shit... what the hell was that?

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: Lara. Refusing to use the door again. I see.

Speaker: Lara
Text: But it's faster this way. Dad.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: Come here, you little monkey.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Are you going on another adventure?

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: My greatest one yet.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Well, I've decided that I should be your assistant.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: Oh, have you? Well, there's no one I'd rather have by my side. But this business... it's too dangerous. Lara, listen to me. Someday you're going to make such a mark on this world. You're going to make me so proud. Give me a moment, darling. I need to take this.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Got to bind this wound... Those leaves should stem the bleeding...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Need some kind of bandage...

Speaker: Lara
Text: An abandoned Cold War installation... What the hell is Trinity doing down there? More Mongol ruins... It looks like the path goes all the way through... to get past that bear.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Those mushrooms... they're deathcaps! I should be able to make a poison...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Mongolian script... can't quite piece it together... These characters look... Mongolian. But I can't read what it says.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Might be able to make something with all this... Should head back to camp and try...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Need to rest... So cold... so tired.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: No, you listen to me. I don't give a damn about my reputation! Don't you dare threaten me! Hello? Hello?!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Dad, what's happening?

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: They're fools!

Speaker: Lara
Text: You're scaring me.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: I'm close Lara... Close to something important. Someday... You'll understand.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I don't want to understand! I just want you to stop. Be my Dad again!

Speaker: Lara
Text: <gasping>

Speaker: Native Man
Text: Sofia! Keep moving!

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Come on! We got ‘em!

Speaker: Native Man
Text: Keep running! Go!

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Run her down.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: We found another camp up here. Fire was still warm. They can't be far. Over.

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Command we're fanning out to pick up the trail.

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: Spread the word: The natives set snares in the clearing...

Speaker: Soldier 4
Text: Get on the radio, see if you can raise the facility.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn, it's still there. Too cramped to fight... Better to draw it out... Bought some time… Dammit...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Shit... that's going to be cold.

Speaker: Lara
Text: A Byzantine war galley? How the hell did it get down here?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Hmm... it's Mongolian. They passed through here... I must be close to the lost city. Must be something up there. Yes! That did it!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Got it! Now to find out what's up there. Look at all this... Why were they carrying so much wealth with them?

Speaker: Lara
Text: This codex details the archery techniques of the toes of the Byzantine empire...

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm not your enemy.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: That remains to be seen. You killed those men back there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I killed them to survive. I suspect you did too.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: How long have they been here?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Days, at most.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: The Invaders took many of my people prisoner. You should leave this place before it's too late.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can't do that. I came here for something important.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: So did they. If I see you again. I'll put an arrow in your throat.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You and I are on the same side. I hope I can prove that to you. What's going on down there?

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: So, there are people who live out here... and they appear to have been here for a very long time... living in isolation for decades, maybe even centuries. I notice elements of her dress, small adornments that would not have been out of place in the Byzantine Empire. Could they possibly be descendants of the Prophet's people? How much do they know about the Lost City or the Divine Source? It's clear Trinity will do anything to find out. I'm afraid that whoever they are, they're in grave danger. Let's hope the old proverb about the enemy of my enemy remains true.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Nothing I can do for him now.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: All units, just got word. Konstantin is on his way down from the prison. We need to get this mess in order before he arrives. Hey... can anyone hear me? Goddamn it, we gotta get comms back up.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Never seen anything like that. Crazy son of a bitch, rushing three armed men with an axe. I don't know how they managed to take one of them alive. Who the hell are these people?

Speaker: Lara
Text: There's more of them arriving...

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Until we get someone out here to shut that pump off. I want those crates as far away from the fire as possible double time. There's ammo in there, and we can't afford to lose it.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We secure?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Haven’t heard any shots a few minutes now.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: I think we're in the clear.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Don't count on it. Stay alert until we get the comms re established with the prison.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We're on our own out here.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: That was Konstantin's chopper... What the hell is he doing down here?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Not for me to say. They took one of the natives alive to question him, but it cost us three men. I'm guessing command wants to know what they find out. Konstantin expects more from us. Someone's going to pay for that mistake...

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: 9mm rounds... flares... Huh... Anyone seen the 50 caliber ammo?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Hey looks like we're gonna be short on ordinance until the next drop! You see anything out by the fences?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Nothing... But we didn't see the first ambush until they were already inside. They knew the layout of this place.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Shit... this was supposed to be a routine op.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: The path is never easy. But Trinity expects us to walk it all the same

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: That’s it. We're out of time. Shoot him. He’ll talk or he'll bleed out.

Speaker: Man
Text: You think I fear death?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Put a bullet in this fucking savage! Now!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Gut shot... awful way to go... Clock's ticking.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: You're going to die here, you understand? Unless you tell me what I want to know.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Not just you. Your whole family. Everyone. They'll all die slow, while we watch.

Speaker: Man
Text: Agios o Theos... Agios profetes... Agios athanatos, eleison imas... They have him... imprisoned... <coughing> Got to... got to...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh no... no...

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: How's it looking?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: I'm not sure I can stop the leak. If this doesn't work, we’ll have to crimp the pipe until we get a new valve.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Not sure we'll be able to find spare parts out here...

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: I left you in charge here.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Yes, sir. But we didn't expect such heavy resistance.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: You were to be my eyes. You must know what is at stake with this operation. You don't.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: No... no... no...

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: How could someone like you?

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Ssshhh, shhhh... go easy, go easy. Don't fear this suffering. Our goal is within reach. If we succeed here...

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Remain faithful and you will share in the glory of the Divine Source.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Oh god... please...

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: What do we do with him?

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Ahhh.... no...

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Nobody touch him.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Looks like we got another fuel leak! What the hell happened?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: This thing is 50 years old... Yeah, looks like the valve failed.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: All right, get it shut. We can't afford to lose any more after that attack.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Okay I got this.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: My eyes... help me.

Speaker: Lara
Text: That's the fuel tank... Got to find a way to destroy it...

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: Konstantin is here, the man who tried to kill me in Syria. He's violent, dangerous... but worse he appears entirely devoted to his misguided beliefs. I seem to have a habit of running afoul of religious zealots. But I suppose it all goes with the territory. His men on the radio mentioned a prisoner with information... could it be one of the natives I encountered? And if so, what does he know? Trinity will not be kind in their methods. Perhaps I can find him... find out what he knows. Earning the trust of these locals might prove useful.

Speaker: Man
Text: Don't shoot. I'm not your enemy.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Who are you people?

Speaker: Man
Text: All that can come later. It you want answers, then listen close. We've managed to destroy the old radio tower, but there are repeaters that keep them connected. We need to shut them down. Help me, and I'll let the others know they can trust you. We need all the allies we can get.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll keep an eye out for them.

Speaker: Man
Text: Good. We don't have much time.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: Roth is determined that I should learn how to shoot. However, he tried to teach me today. I was utterly hopeless. I've always said in the field you can't go wrong with a stout stick and good boots. I told him I was a man of words, not of weapons. He laughed and said that he hoped I could find the right words to slow down a charging bison. I told him that that's what he was for. Bless him for trying, though. I don't think there ll be anymore lessons somehow.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Roth always said I must've gotten my sharp eyes and steady hands from mom. That summer he taught me to shoot instead. I took to it... maybe too well.

Speaker: Lord Croft
Text: I hope you received my last tape in good time. I am becoming increasingly fond of recording these messages to you. Ana says that I need time away from my books and papers every so often, if only to remember why I'm doing all this. I know you hate me going away but it will be worth it one day. It will all be worth it. Sending my love to you. Work hard in school.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I know your work was important, but it didn't feel like it at the time. Still, it taught me independence, how to look after myself. Important lessons as it turns out.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Communication repeaters. Trinity must have installed these.

Speaker: Lara
Text: This prisoner... Maybe I can find him.

Speaker: Trader
Text: Look, I'm on your side here. I've been working as a maintenance tech for Trinity out here but I have got to get out of here. These people are insane. I’ve been stockpiling gear. It's yours, if you can pay for it. They won’t notice a few missing items, but if they catch wind, or if they see me with you, I'm a dead man. I'll need some untraceable currency in case things go south. Gold preferably. You think we can make a deal?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll see what I can dig up...

Speaker: Mysterious voice
Text: <via radio> Your reports have ceased. Trinity's growing concerned.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We‘ve had trouble with the natives. Our communications were offline, but everything is now under control.

Speaker: Mysterious voice
Text: If the situation becomes untenable, we will step in.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: It won't. You sent me for a reason. I was chosen for this. I will succeed.

Speaker: Mysterious voice
Text: See that you do.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Hey!

Speaker: Ana
Text: Lara! Are you okay? Oh, thank God!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Ana? What - what are you doing here?!

Speaker: Ana
Text: I don't know! I can't remember. What's happening, Lara? I'm scared.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm so sorry. I didn't think they'd come after you. This is all my fault.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Who... who are they? What do they want?

Speaker: Lara
Text: The same thing my father was after.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Oh no... Lara... I told you not to do this. Whatever they want, just give it to them.

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's not that simple. Just hold on. I'll get us out of here... somehow... Don't touch her! Please... no...

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Talk.

Speaker: Lara
Text: No! No, you bastard!

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Where is the Divine Source?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Please! Just stop! I don't know where it is!

Speaker: Ana
Text: That's enough. She doesn't know.

Speaker: Lara
Text: What- You. No... You're with them?! I can't believe this. You... you cu-

Speaker: Ana
Text: You couldn't let it go, could you? I knew you'd find your way to this place.

Speaker: Lara
Text: What did you expect?

Speaker: Ana
Text: It doesn't have to be this way. We seek the same thing. We could use someone like you. You want a purpose in your life; we can provide that.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You've got to be kidding. I've seen how Trinity operates.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Is that a no?

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's a no fucking way. Tell me, Ana. Were you recruited by Trinity before or after you started screwing my father?

Speaker: Ana
Text: I loved Richard. But he was blinded by idealism, and it destroyed him. What would you do with the artifact? Show it to the world? Redeem your father's good name? You're still so naive... just a frightened little girl trying to walk in her daddy's shoes.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We're done here.

Speaker: Ana
Text: No. Not yet.

Speaker: Ana
Text: You and I... we can still be on the same side of history. Think about it, Lara.

Speaker: Lara
Text: This isn't over. <yelling> Bastard!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Perhaps that's all he knows how to be?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I thought I was alone.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: So did I, but here we are. So what should I call my new acquaintance?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Nothing. I won't be staying.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Konstantin has little patience.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Nor do I.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: So I see. Nice trick. Can you get us out of here?

Speaker: Lara
Text: There's no us. I don't even know who you are, or why you're here. Sorry... I'm not feeling particularly trusting right now.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: You won't get far without me.

Speaker: Lara
Text: <laughing> You don't know how far I've come. What do you know about them?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: A sect, ancient and secretive. They believe themselves to be doing the work of God.

Speaker: Lara
Text: From what I've seen, they're pretty far from holy. There's a breeze coming through here... might be able to breakthrough.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: And what do you plan to do with that? Careful. They'll have heard that...

Speaker: Lara
Text: All the more reason to get out of here.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Is there a way out?

Speaker: Lara
Text: No... but I found something that might be useful.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Careful, we don't want to attract attention. It worked! Can you get out?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Wait! Let me out. I can help you.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can't trust you.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: We may not be enemies. I can see that. I suspect you do too.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I work better alone.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I know the layout.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm a fast learner.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I've no doubt of that... Maybe I can offer you something more valuable. I know what you're all after. Thank you.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I'm Jacob.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Lara. Take this. In case we get separated.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: We have to move. The guards will be coming through on rounds any moment.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Do you know the way out?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Yes... I've had some time to study this place.

Speaker: Lara
Text: How long were you in that cell?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Long enough to learn that Konstantin won't stop until he's found what he's looking for.

Speaker: Lara
Text: The Divine Source? Is it here?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Mmm. Trust must go both ways. Lara.

Speaker: Lara
Text: What is this?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: A history lesson... This place has its own scars.

Speaker: Lara
Text: It was a work camp... The Soviets sent prisoners here... to work in the mines.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Even that wasn't enough. They captured our people, took children from their mothers to work as slaves...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Those... those are ancient. What did they find?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: You'll have to ask them. We have to go, we aren't safe here. Our best chance of escape is to make our way to the old train yard.

Speaker: Lara
Text: And what then?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: My Village is in a valley on the other side of the mountain, we'll be safe there.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Command post 2, last chopper outbound.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Roger.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: That It be the last shipment. Reports of trouble at the communications depot. More natives?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Negative. We caught an armed intruder from the outside.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Stay here. I'll take care of this.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: All right... hold on, almost got it. That's it. You're good to go!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Okay let's move this thing out! Konstantin wants a team up at the copper mill before the storm sets in!
[Lara kills all the mercenaries.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob? I've found a way to open the inner gate.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Head to the courtyard. I'm already inside.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: I have patrols headed to all the major dig sites. Here, here... and here

Speaker: Ana
Text: What about these installations?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Ana! I need to get in there!

Speaker: Ana
Text: What about these installations?

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: I can send smaller groups - a few sharpshooters and scouts.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Do it. We have a lot of ground to cover and Trinity wants the artifact found as soon as possible.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We aren't getting anything on satellite. Too much interference. Constant cloud cover... it's as if this place doesn't exist.

Speaker: Ana
Text: It wasn't supposed to. If this is truly where the Prophet hid the Divine Source, he couldn't have picked a better place.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob! What is he doing? Shit... be careful, Lara.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: This is the place... I can feel it.

Speaker: Ana
Text: The Soviet records are quite convincing. But I want to get into those ruins myself.

Speaker: Ana
Text: I cannot wait to leave this frozen hell.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Then I have good news. Reconnaissance from the scouts. The natives have a settlement on the other side of the mountain.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Soon. You will have your day.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We both will. Just as long as you don't lose focus again.

Speaker: Ana
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: You're sentimental about her... the Croft girl. I can tell because she's still alive. We can‘t afford to dwell on the past.

Speaker: Ana
Text: You doubt me? You know what I've given to Trinity. What I've sacrificed! What I face <coughing> I'm fine.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Life has not been kind to either at us. But I swore I'd always protect you.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Now who's being sentimental7

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: I promise you, all of this will be worth it in the end. With the Divine Source, you will live. But more importantly, you will live in a world cleansed of sin.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Send your men to this settlement. Find out what they know

Speaker: Lara
Text: [to Jacob] It's too dangerous.

Speaker: Ana
Text: [start smoking a cigarette] Let me have my pleasures. None of this will matter the day our work is accomplished.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: <via radio> Konstantin, you're needed in the holding cells.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We're in this together, sister. Remember.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Always.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: [to Lara] What are you doing?!

Speaker: Lara
Text: [reading old manuscript] “Mankind shall be judged, the non-believers turned to ash and swept away. And the pure of faith will be raised up and given... life eternal.” [alarm] Get out! I'll find you.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We've got to find them... keep looking. They have to be here somewhere. Prison ﬂoor is clear. Eyes open. She has to still be here.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: On it.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Alright. Got to find a way out of here...

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Sweep and clear every room, we HAVE to find her.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara, the train yard is on the north end of the gulag. I'll wait for you there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: On my way.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: I need assistance, the control room door is locked from inside. We're gonna have to break it down.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn, got to get out of here.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: We're gonna have to break it down. Check all these doors! Tear this place apart! Alpha, what's the situation?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: No sign of her yet. Heading to the control room now.

Speaker: Lara
Text: [solving puzzle] There.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: She's here! Get in position!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Bust this thing open! Come on! [sees Lara] Oh shit.

Speaker: Lara
Text: No!

Speaker: Lara
Text: [trying to reload AK-47 taken from the mercenary] Come on...

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: You re going to die! She's got an assault rifle!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: The prisoner is here! Take her out! Hold this position, push her back!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: She's still standing. Someone... just kill her!
[After a fierce fight for life...]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob? Is that you, Jacob?!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara, be careful, they're everywhere. You’ll run into some trouble - <over the radio> There he is! Take him out!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn it! <radio silence> Shit!
[She find a camp.]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: For the first time in weeks, things are becoming clear. I know there's something hidden here. The Soviets came looking for it, too... and now Trinity and Ana. Ana... God, I still don’t quite believe it. All this time. Did she watch Dad as well? I've got to keep moving find Jacob and join his people. If I can prove myself to them, maybe he will tell me more about this place.
[After walking a little further Lara accidentally goes into the mercenary camp.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Hit the lights! Now!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: We got her!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Come on, take her down!
[Lara kills all the mercenaries, but here come some reinforcement.]

Speaker: Armored Mercenary
Text: Hostile spotted, she's alone. Move out, and make it quick.
[She kills them too and go to a cabin with couple of dead body in it.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: What happened here... <via radio> Jacob? I think I'm close to the train yard... Are you there? [no response]
[Soon she see Jacob killing a mercenary with a knife.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: What took you so long?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I thought I lost you back there.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Not a chance. Thanks for getting me out of that place. [he sees a chopper] Let's move! We can get out through there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Watch out! Ah!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: <via helicopter loudspeaker> We've got them! They're on the tracks. Don't let them escape!

[Lara run for her life, fleeing a helicopter shooting her. When she walks onto an ice-covered lake, the ice breaks under her feet, and she plunges into the icy water. While dying, she remembers about her father.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Dad, is everything alright? Dad?

[She enters her father’s office and finds him dead at his desk. Next to it is a newspaper with a headline on the main page “DISGRACED! RENOWNED HISTORIAN’S WILD CLAIMS DEBUNKED”. In the next scene, we see Lara in some sort of hut. Jacob fumigates her with a bunch of herbs.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Take it easy. Drink this, it'll help.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You could have left me in that river.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Would you have left me?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'd have thought about it.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: What makes you think I didn't? So what makes you risk so much to come here?

Speaker: Lara
Text: The Divine Source.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I know what you're looking for. But I want to know why.

Speaker: Lara
Text: When I was young, it was just my father and I. He was an archeologist too. In his last years, he was obsessed with myths about immortality. Of course, no one believed him… including me. Our last conversation was a fight. He… He took his own life. I thought I'd come to terms with it, but…

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Something else happened.

Speaker: Lara
Text: And I saw something that I thought was impossible. It changed everything. I realized my father was right. He died alone and broken. But he died for something.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: So you believe the Divine Source is real?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I honestly don't know. But if there is any truth to it. I have to find out. It… it needs to be researched and studied. It could make a difference to the world. It's not something to be hidden away.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: A difference is not always for the best. Would you wish Trinity to have the secret to immortality?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Of course not.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Then I would ask you not to abandon your quest, but to alter its path. Join me and my people. Help us repel Konstantin and Trinity.

Speaker: Lara
Text: And after that's done?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Then you leave our valley untouched, but knowing that you've done the right thing.

Speaker: Lara
Text: No. I'm sorry. I can't do that.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Can’t or won’t?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll fight Trinity with you but my goal remains the same. If I give up now…

Speaker: Jacob
Text: You'd feel like you'd be letting him down?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Not just him. I need answers. Jacob. I need to understand. You're leaving?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Right now, my concern is for my Village. It's over the mountain pass, a day's journey on foot. But there may be a faster way through the old copper mine. You rest. I'll be back soon.
[After some time, Lara wakes up, but Jacob is not around.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob… are you there? Damn it, where is he…
[She finds a base camp.]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: Alone again. There is something about him that I can't quite put my finger on. It's strange, but almost comforting… Like I could tell him anything and it wouldn't faze him. I sense no judgment from him. Yet, at the same time, he's hard to read. My instincts tell me he's a good man. He saved my life - I think I can trust him, at least for now.
[Lara descends from the mountain where Jacob’s hut is located and finds one of his man wounded.]

Speaker: Man
Text: Don't shoot. I’m with Jacob. He told us to wait for you… but these bastards found us first.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh god, are you all right?

Speaker: Man
Text: I'll live. But I need a safe place to rest in case the invaders return. There's a cave, across the bridge over there. A wolf den, they won't look there. But I can't clear it out on my own, not like this. If you could kill them, we'll have a safe place to regroup. I might even have something for that pistol of yours. Can you help us?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Yes, of course. Stay out of sight. I'll be back.

Speaker: Man
Text: Thank you… Jacob was right about you.
[Lara finds a Soviet prison camp.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Soviet soldiers… something awful happened here…
[At the base camp.]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: I think about Dad every day. For years, I was so angry with him. For losing himself in his work, for chasing what I thought were fairytales. I had no idea. I keep telling myself that I was young… that I couldn't understand... But I still lost him. And now… for some reason, I feel more connected to him than I ever did when he was alive. He never got this far, but I know he's with me. The Divine Source is here and I'm going to find it. He knew that it could change the way we understand the human soul... that it could change the world. But he's gone now, and I’m the only one left who knows he was right.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara! Are you okay?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Yes. I'm at the base of the old Soviet mill…

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I’m making my way to the mine entrance at the top of the facility. Can you meet me there?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm on my way.
[She finds prisoners caged beds.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Cages… like they were animals…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Do we have a map of the faculty?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Negative. Even if we did, there's a lot of structural damage from the revolt.
[Lara picks up some alcohol and a rug and makes Molotov’s Cocktail.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Gonna be dangerous, getting up higher. Weather and elements have taken their toll.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: So this is where the Soviets broke through?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Yeah. First contact was in one of the mine shafts, and they shifted all operations to retrieval. But it looks like the revolt came within a week.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: <via radio> Yeah, looks like we found a jackpot up here. All sorts of artifacts. It matches the description of the Soviet intel. Yeah, this is where they broke through into the ruins. Any sign of the escaped prisoners?
[Lara stealth kill the mercenary.]
[Having dealt with the mercenaries Lara continues to climb up the Soviet mill.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara! Are you there? I'm pinned down, Lara, you need to get out… [the connection snaps]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob! Shit.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: They went through a lot of trouble to seal it up. It might be the artifact we're looking for.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: God willing. That'd be too easy.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Let me see that activity log. I think it mentioned the safe… Manifest says the Soviets stored the most valuable artifacts from the site in this safe. Let's crack it open… who's got the torch?

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: On it.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Okay the rest of you: don't touch anything. Catalog whatever artifacts you find.
[Lara kill them with a single shot of a poison arrow, but couple of steps later she falls into an ambush.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: She's coming through! Hold your positions!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: There she is! Open fire!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Kill her, now! This whole place is going up!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Finish her! We gotta get out of here, before we all burn!

Speaker: Shielded Mercenary
Text: I have visual confirmation.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: <via radio> Kill her. Now.

Speaker: Shielded Mercenary
Text: Yes, sir.

Speaker: Shielded Mercenary 2
Text: Fan out! We have her surrounded.
[Lara sets the mercenaries on fire using Molotov cocktails. Getting out of the burning building, she sees as one of the mercenaries wants to attack Jacob from behind. She kills the mercenary.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: We seem to be making a habit of saving each other.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Thanks. I'm glad you're okay. Is that the way through?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Yes. There will be more of them inside. You don't have to do this.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Can't get rid of me so easily. I still need some answers.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Then there's no time to waste.
[Lara enters an abandoned mine with Jacob.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: This path will take us all the way through the mountain. My people used these ways until the Soviets arrived and began digging.

Speaker: Lara
Text: What did they find down here?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Enough to make them curious. They used machines and explosives to dig deeper, did quite a lot of damage. Many of the old paths collapsed… But it's safe now. Or… It used to be…
[A small earthquake occurs.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: That doesn't sound good.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Trinity must have found the old mining equipment… They're trying to finish what the Soviets started…

Speaker: Lara
Text: And there's no other way through.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I'm afraid not… not anymore. This… complicates things…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: What's the problem? We're behind schedule.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Shh, shh!

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Hold on, the wires here are corroded, but I think I can bypass it. Almost ready…

Speaker: Lara
Text: They're going to bring the whole place down…

Speaker: Jacob
Text: The Soviets destroyed much of the old paths.
[The mine is starting to collapse.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Hurry!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Find Sofia. Tell her Trinity is here!
[He's engulfed with stones.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Oh fuck! Aaaah! It's comin' down! Watch out.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Just move.
[Lara manages to get out of the crumbling mine. She’s trying to contact Jacob.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob! Jacob, are you there, can you hear me?
[No answer. Lara has no choice but to go forward alone.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Maybe we can get the elevator working. Got to be a way out up there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: This is bad…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Hold on. I think I can… <grumbling> I can't… believe… this thing… Okay… Okay! I can get power to that console!
[Lara quietly shoots them with her bow. She tries to start the elevator herself, but it just collapses.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh shit. Now what?
[She finds a new gear – Combat Knife.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: This should come in handy.
[In the depths of the caves, Lara finds a dilapidated, lost city with easily recognizable European architecture. In Russia.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Could this be part of the lost city? Whoa! Too close.
[At the next base camp...]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: Separated again. I just hope Jacob's still alive. I don’t know exactly where I am. That's rapidly becoming the story of my life. I’m fighting to survive, yet strangely… I feel hopeful. There are incredible ruins all around me. This must be part of the Prophet's lost city. But how much more is true ? The Divine Source… could it really be here?
[Near the camp she finds a mural.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: This mural shows the Prophet, preaching in Constantinople…

Speaker: Lara
Text: These ruins are incredible…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: All right, we're ready. Let it fly.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh no!

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Good shot. Looks like that one will hold.

Speaker: Mercenary 2
Text: Looks like Ana was right about the Lost City… The Source has to be some where down here…

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Okay let's get that door down.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: This wall looks like it was put up in hurry.

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Shit. I don't know if I can fix this. Not with these tools.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: I can feel air coming through from the other side. Well, what’s the plan, then?

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: Try raising Overwatch again. If they know we survived the cave-in, maybe they can send help.

Speaker: Mercenary 3
Text: We just tried a few minutes ago. No one on the other end but static.
[Having shot the mercenaries, Lara finds a huge ancient door with several thick cables attached to it.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Hmm, someone tried to get through this door before. If we can't get that door open, we need to start looking for another way out of here…
[Throwing off one of the cars, with the cable attached to it from a bridge, Lara is attacked by several well-armed mercenaries.]

Speaker: Mercenary 1
Text: She's there, by the murals! Open fire!

[Lara takes out the machine gun and starts fighting for her life. After she kills a few mercenaries, their more experienced brothers come down to the rope room. They throw smoke grenades to confuse Lara, but she still manages to survive and win. She moves on, climbing an icy steep wall. At other car to which the cable is attached Lara tries to move the car with her rope.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Hmm. I'm not strong enough. If I can bring down that crane, it should be enough to rip open the door. Right, that should work. That did it!

[By manipulating the cargo, Lara manages to rip out the door, but to get to it she had to run through the crumbling arm of the crane. She gets into a small room with a statue in the center. There's a huge painting on the floor.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: This statue must be the Immortal Prophet…And this… it shows the exodus of his people from the deserts of Syria. They settled in a hidden valley and built a great city. Kitezh… To protect the city and its people, the Prophet raised an army of warriors… But what is this showing? It's not the Divine Source they're holding. It's something else… something else… but what? “And his warriors forged for him an Atlas. That the Prophet might always know his city and its secrets.” A map of the city… it could show the way to the Divine Source.

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's a wonder this place is still standing.
[She leaves the cave and explores the ruins of an ancient castle. Soon Lara falls into a trap - she is surrounded by several archers, led by a red-haired young girl named Sofia.]

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Stop right there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Easy! Easy! You know I'm not with Trinity.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Why should we believe you?

Speaker: Lara
Text: I escaped with one of yours. A man named Jacob.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Where is he now?

Speaker: Lara
Text: We were together but we got separated in the mines.

Speaker: Warrior
Text: She killed him!

Speaker: Lara
Text: No! No, no, no, no...

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Jacob would never trust an outsider.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Please, listen! I'm not your enemy.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: [tightening the bowstring] I warned you. You should have left.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Sofia! Enough.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Father!
[They hug.]

Speaker: Sofia
Text: I thought I lost you.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I'm glad you made it out of there. Forgive Sofia, she is... cautious.

Speaker: Lara
Text: In her position, I'd be the same way.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: What did you find out?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Trinity is coming in force. We must prepare.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: And her?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: She's a friend. On my word, no harm will come to her.

Speaker: Lara
Text: These ruins... we must be near the Prophet's Lost City.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Come. We do not have much time. Prepare the weapon stores, secure the battlements. Go! Now! They're almost here. But we're outnumbered.

Speaker: Villager
Text: The children and elders are vulnerable.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Go. Get them into the catacombs. Light the fires - the valley must be alerted.

Speaker: Lara
Text: [seeing the village] Incredible...

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Sofia, muster our fighters then meet me in the upper village.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Don't disappear again, Father.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: There is much to do. If we had more time...

Speaker: Lara
Text: Later. For now, I'll do what I can to help.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: You! Head down to the old radio, get the generator working. We need to get one last transmission out, and let the other settlements know what's coming...

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: I’ll do what I can.

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: Jacob and his people are resilient, I'll give them that. Trinity is on their way... they could do with my help. And this Atlas from the mural - if it really is some kind of map of the ruins, I've got to find it before Ana. If I don't then all these deaths will have been in vain. And I can't have that on my conscience.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: You two, I need eyes out across the valley. Head to the cliffs and take watch. I want to know the moment you see their helicopters.

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: Yes, of course.

Speaker: Villager 3
Text: If we see anything, we'll sound the horns.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: Go with God. We must keep them away from the Acropolis Tower, no matter the cost. We'll send the families into the catacombs below, but we have to keep the enemy engaged here, on this side of the valley.

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: Sofia and her warriors have already fought the invaders, she says they're well equipped.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: Yes, but we know the valley. We use the ruins and the woods to our advantage.

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: I hope to God you're right... They've got helicopters... We should expect them to come from the air.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: Mmm. The soviets did as well. So we stay beneath the trees, they can't hit what they can't see.

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: They'll cut us down, no matter where we fight.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: We know this land better than they ever will. Don't forget that.

Speaker: Archer
Text: [to Lara] Greetings. How did you find this place? What brought you here? War is coming. We have to prepare… The Soviets left everything when we drove them out. Most of it is just waste, but there's still the odd treasure to be found.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: Damn... If we only had one more day to prepare...

Speaker: Villager 2
Text: But we can drive them out... can't we? You were there when we drove the Soviets out. People need to hear we can do it again.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: I didn't think we could do it then. And it took ten years. Better to say nothing...

Speaker: Villager 3
Text: I need more wood for the fire. They needed most of the lumber to repair the guard towers. We'll have to make do with what we have. Well, if they need arrowheads for the battle, then I need more firewood. We'll have to make do with what we have. Can you see anything from up there?

Speaker: Villager 4
Text: No, I'm trying to get the structure repaired.

Speaker: Villager 5
Text: Jacob said they'd come. We never recovered from the Soviets... And now this...

Speaker: Villager 6
Text: I've already cut plenty. Besides, I don't know how much more time you'll have left to forge...

Speaker: Villager 7
Text: Mm... We can make points faster than broadheads. That should be our focus.

Speaker: Villager 8
Text: You there! We could use some help, if that's what you're here for…
[Lara is leaving the village.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara. I'm sorry if Sofia was... less than welcoming.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I understand. I'm just glad you were there to vouch for me.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: My people have spent decades fighting outsiders. It's not an easy habit to break. See if you can lend a hand with the preparations. A little hard work would go a long way towards building trust.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll see what I can do.
[She can hear the roar of a horn.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Trinity will be here soon…
[She walks into a small camp in the woods, where Sofia briefs her people.]

Speaker: Sofia
Text: They will likely come from the air. Jacob is assembling fighters in the upper village to draw their attention there. The children and those too old to fight will be safely hidden in the Acropolis catacombs. I will go there once things are in hand here.

Speaker: Warrior
Text: You said they were heavily armed. How can we expect to beat them?

Speaker: Sofia
Text: The fight will not be won in open combat. They will hit us hard and fast, and we will take losses. They hope to crush us in their initial assault, but we will turn their eagerness into our advantage. This will be a long engagement. If we hope to survive, we must wear them down slowly strategically. We will bleed them from a hundred cuts, until they have nothing left. Only then will we be victorious. For now, we light the fires, warn the others in the valley. Today, we win by surviving. Gather as much ammunition and supplies as you can. Hide them in the caves and ruins. When you've completed your duties, rendezvous in the upper village. Understood?

Speaker: Warrior 2
Text: Yes!

Speaker: Warrior 3
Text: Understood.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Good. Now go. The Prophet be with you.

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: Trinity being here, the people they're hurting... that's down to me. I led them here. God, it's happening again, isn't it? People are suffering because of my actions. No, no... you can't think like this, Lara, or you really will drive yourself crazy. Trinity would have found this place sooner or later. At least I have the chance to help stop them... of getting to the Divine Source first and using it to benefit the world... rather than causing more pain and suffering. Just need to focus. For everyone who's gone before, for everyone I've lost... just keep moving.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara!I could use your help. Our people are spread thin across the valley. If you light the signal tower, they'll know that the danger

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll do what I can...

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio>Once the fire is lit, they'll know what to do.
[Lara climbs to the top of the mountain and lights he tower.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Thank you, Lara. Our people have been warned... that should give them time to evacuate. Meet me in the upper village, I'm gathering our forces here.

Speaker: Lara
Text: All right. Jacob, helicopters are headed your way!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Get here as fast as you can.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via helicopter loudspeaker> Surrender at once. Resistance will be met with deadly force.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Get here as fast as you can. Get behind the barricades! Move, move!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via helicopter loudspeaker> Lay down your weapons, or you will be shot!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Look out! Stay under cover! Pull back! Stay together!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via helicopter loudspeaker> If you do not cease fire, we will kill you all. You have 30 seconds.
[Lara comes to the village, which is already in flames. She hides behind the rubble. Jacob and his two men have been brought to their knees.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Where is the Divine Source?! Tell me!
[A soldier shoots him in the head.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Stop! Don't hurt anyone else!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Where is it?

Speaker: Villager
Text: Wait... wait! There's a map... The Atlas! It will show you the way!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Okay. Tell me about this Atlas!
[Jacob gives Lara a signal and attacks a soldier. He kills him and throws his shotgun to Lara. She starts running through a burning village killing soldiers Terminator-style.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Weapons free. Kill everything that moves.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> We're under fire at the edge of the village! If you can hear me, we need your help.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Hostiles in that structure. Stand back, we've got this. Do not let them escape. Shoot the runners!
[A flamethrower stands in Lara's way.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> We can't hold this position much longer! If we can't outflank them, we're going to lose the village.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via radio> We're bugging out. Withdraw and regroup at the drop.
[We're moving to Trinity base the next morning. Kontantin, like any self-respecting sick psychopath, prays.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via radio> ...we've been overrun by the natives. Croft is with them... several casualties... men are dead and scattered...

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: We should have killed her.

Speaker: Ana
Text: You have nothing to show for your efforts. Perhaps she'll succeed where you're failing.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: I will not fail.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Trinity will step in if you do. And you know what that means? I'm expendable. They have no interest in my survival. I need the power of the Source. <coughing>

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: And you will have it. Don't lose faith, Ana. This is God's will. Our success is inevitable.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Please. Just find it. My time is running out.

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: <praying> I've come so far, I've endured so much. These final barriers you have set before me... These sins you have forced me to commit... they must have a purpose. Only you can show me the way. Grant me strength to continue, for her. For you, for Trinity. Please... Show me the way.
[His palms are starting to bleed.]

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: Then blood it shall be.

[We return to the village of the coolest archers in Middle-earth. There are many wounded around, but the number of people around has not decreased much. How these poor people managed to defeat the heavily armed military we were not shown, of course.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Stay with me, stay with me.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm sorry, your people don't deserve this.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: It is our chosen path... our duty. It's never been easy.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I understand what it's like to lose people. Trinity won't stop, will they?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I doubt it. They have many resources.

Speaker: Lara
Text: And the Atlas?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: It's an ancient map to the old city, but Trinity won't find it at the tower. Many of my people live in those ruins. They won't be prepared for what's coming.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can help them, Jacob.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Would you do this for us, or for that which you seek?

Speaker: Lara
Text: Right now they're one and the same.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I'll be back with reinforcements, after I've tended to the wounded.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Yes, what is it?

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: We're in bad shape, Jacob. The attack left us in shambles, and we have no one to send to the Acropolis...

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I know... I'll see to the wounded here, we have to get them to someplace safe. When that's done, we'll gather anyone still able to fight… Sofia will hold them off until we can arrive.

Speaker: Villager 1
Text: I hope to God you're right. I'll send a runner when we're ready.
[Lara finds a way to the tower.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob, it's a mess up here. There's no sign of your people.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Sofia might have taken them into the catacombs beneath the tower. But I've lost contact with her.

Speaker: Lara
Text: All right, I'll look for her there.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> We're almost done evacuating the wounded here. I'll join you soon.
[Lara comes out of the cave and sees the tower. There's a helicopter flying towards it.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: I hope I'm not too late...
[When she comes closer, she notices the fire. Trinity's already taken over the tower.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Oh god, no.
[She's hiding, eavesdropping on the soldiers who are holding Sophia's men hostage.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: <via radio> The courtyard's clear! What do you want us to do with these prisoners?

Speaker: Konstantin
Text: <via radio> Take 'em out!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Don't shoot! We will-
[The soldier pulls the trigger. Lara's in shock.]
[Lara picks up her bow and starts killing quietly.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Missed one. Be more thorough going forward. What's our status?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: Looks all clear here. Team 4 is searching the tunnels for any sign of the Atlas.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: Let's move, the rest of them can catch up. I don't want to miss out on the hunt.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 4
Text: Hands in the air! Now! Drop it! Drop the gun!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Don't shoot! We will-
[One of the soldiers explodes something and the floor under Lara's feet falls apart.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 5
Text: Fire in the hole!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Ahh! Dammit!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 6
Text: Hey, hey, hold up! These bastards are resourceful. They might have set up some traps.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 7
Text: Don't worry. I'll kill anything that moves.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 6
Text: Just take it slow. Stay sharp.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 8
Text: All right, my friend. Your turn.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I won't tell you anything.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 8
Text: See, I believe you. Which is why we're just going to beat you until you stop breathing.
[Lara kills the soldiers and frees Sofia.]

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Bastards! Untie me. I'll kill every last one of them!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Easy, Sofia.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: So much bloodshed. We're losing too many people.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Maybe your people have sacrificed enough.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: It's... all we've known. I misjudged you, Lara.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Tell me how I can help you.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: I've got to get the rest to safety, but the entrance to the catacombs is blocked.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'll find a way clear it.

Speaker: Prisoner 1
Text: You're going to be okay.

Speaker: Prisoner 2
Text: Hurgh-Ah! I'm all right... I'll be all right... Just help us get the others to safety...

Speaker: Prisoner 1
Text: Shhh, shhh... just breathe.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: We'll get you to safety, just hold on.
[Lara breaks the wall with a pickaxe. He walks down a narrow aisle until he finds a barred window.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: It's barred from the other side... There it is... maybe I can unblock it from here... The catacombs... we'll be safe there. Hmm, this should do it.
[She finds the cartridge from the underbarrel grenade launcher and attaches it to the arrow.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Get clear of the door!
[She blows up the door and lets everyone out.]

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Thank you, Lara. They'll be safe in the catacombs for now. I know you seek the Divine Source. But my people will die to protect it.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Your people are already dying. You can't protect it forever.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: We've lasted this long. But for now, I'm glad to have you as an ally.

Speaker: Villager
Text: They're converging on the tower! We've still got people there!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Get the others to safety. They'll need you.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Lara! I'm here. But we're taking fire from the choppers. I need you to get Trinity's attention, any way you can.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Leave it to me. I can do this.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Over here, we need your help! Hostile to the rear!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Down! Get down! Bastard! Jacob, it looks like we've got the upper hand!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: <via radio> Good work. Those choppers should be in range soon.

Speaker: Lara
Text: They're here! We did it.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: <via radio> Lara, are you there? Trinity is swarming the tower. We're trapped in the catacombs beneath!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Damn. Just hold on... I'm on my way!
[Lara, like the two-meter-high Austrian, is making her way through the corridors of an ancient temple.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: This is Team 5, we're heading into the catacombs. Need some backup here.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Got it, on our way.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: Why don't we just drop in some grenades and be done with it?
[Lara attacks the soldiers with a rifle.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: Hold this position, push her back! Reinforcements are here, pin her down! Go! Go! Keep your heads down! She's still standing. Someone... just kill her!

Speaker: Lara
Text: Come and try! Come on!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: Now, goddammit, take her out!
[After killing everyone she could, Lara returns to the camp.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Jacob... They're gone.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: I fear this battle is far from over.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Will you tell me more about this place?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: You've earned that much. Come with me.
[He leads her to the edge of the ancient building where the camp is located.]

Speaker: Jacob
Text: In ancient times, our Prophet brought the Divine Source to this valley. My ancestors built Kitezh to protect it from the outside world.

Speaker: Lara
Text: To what end? What is the Divine Source, Jacob?

Speaker: Jacob
Text: An artifact from a time long forgotten. We believe it holds a fragment of God's soul. Legend tells us those who beheld the Source were granted immortality, but others have always been drawn here seeking its power.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Trinity...

Speaker: Jacob
Text: Yes. They seek to spread their darkness across the world. With the Source, their soldiers would be... unstoppable.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Then help me find it... before they do!

Speaker: Jacob
Text: This is not your burden.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Of course it is! My father died for this.

Speaker: Jacob
Text: You can't fill the emptiness inside you, Lara. You can only set it free.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I'm going to find it. With or without you.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: Wait.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Sofia, let me go. I have to do what I can.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: You spilled blood for us. I want to help.

Speaker: Lara
Text: You know where the Atlas is.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: The Cathedral. In the archives below. But we won't follow you there.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Why? What will I find?

Speaker: Sofia
Text: There are others. The Deathless Ones. They will kill any who trespass. My father believes they will stop Trinity.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I can't take that chance.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: I know. Here, take this.  It will help you reach the Cathedral.

Speaker: Sofia
Text: <via radio> Lara... If you're headed to the cathedral, Trinity will be everywhere.

Speaker: Lara
Text: I know... But I have no choice.
[She finds a new camp.]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: So much violence and death. Jacob's people have been through so much, yet they continue to fight. They are bound by an oath taken by their ancestors... a duty handed down from the past. But I see a people who simply want to live in peace. I believe it's time for them to let go of the past. If I can find the Atlas, it might lead to the Divine Source.
[Lara sails to the mercenary camp through the muddy, cold water, and then, getting to the rear, starts killing them quietly.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: I don't think we'll see much resistance from the natives, not after this.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: We'll probably catch a few more stragglers slinking around the woods. But yeah. They're done.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 1
Text: You take any alive?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: I had one I probably could have delivered, but the bonus wasn't worth it.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 1
Text: Yeah. One of them surrendered, and the company men were watching. Had to turn him over.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: They taking them back to the old prison?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 1
Text: Just the ones they think might know something about the Atlas. Konstantin's gonna ask them a few questions… They've got the rest back up near the cathedral.
[Having made their way deep into the camp, the enemies become stronger - tactical helmets, armor. A helicopter flies in the air.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: The hired guns can finish the sweep down here, we're needed back at base camp. Leave 'em to it.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 4
Text: Roger, we're clear.

Speaker: Helicopter
Text: <via radio> Copy that.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: All right, once we finish scrubbing this site, you men can head on up with the rest of them.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 4
Text: So what are we looking for exactly?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: Command thinks the Atlas is beneath the cathedral. We're looking for anything that might confirm that theory.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 4
Text: Like, what, exactly?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: If we knew, you wouldn't be looking. Documents, maps, anything that might confirm the intel.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 4
Text: Why don't we just go down and get it?
[Lara kills them and gets closer to the cathedral.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 5
Text: So what did he say?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 6
Text: It's not his call, but he's going to put a recommendation for us both. Then there'll be... an initiation ceremony of some sort.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 5
Text: So that's it? That's all he can do?
[Lara keeps moving through the camp killing Trinity's hireling.]

Speaker: Radio
Text: <via radio> Heads up, we seem to have lost contact with the team sweeping the lower valley. Do you have eyes on them?

Speaker: Radio
Text: <via radio> Negative... possible hostiles?

Speaker: Radio
Text: <via radio> Could just be radio interference, but Konstantin's not taking chances.
[Lara gets to the top of the cathedral, climbs up its wall.]

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 7
Text: So this is really it, huh? If they do find the Atlas in there, what's next?

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 8
Text: The Atlas is a map. It's supposed to point the way to whatever the natives are protecting out here.
[While Lara climbs inside the cathedral, she hears Ana's voice.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: These ruins hide much, Commander. You cannot dig too deep or too fast.

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> The men are trying to be cautious -

Speaker: Ana
Text: Cautious? Why? We no longer have time for caution. And I no longer have the patience for it.

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> With all due respect, if all of my men die down there then-

Speaker: Ana
Text: We are all expendable here, Commander. What matters are results. The stakes are too high.

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> We've reached the lower level, but we have another problem. We've lost our rear guard.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Define "lost", Commander.

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> No radio contact, no visual contact. Just gone.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Then proceed without them.

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> That's outside mission protocol, ma'am. It introduces unnecessary risks.

Speaker: Ana
Text: Can you achieve your goal without them?

Speaker: Commander
Text: <via radio> Ma'am. I don't think we're alone down here! I need tactical support.

Speaker: Ana
Text: No. We are stretched too thin across this valley. If you feel you are being pursued, then I suggest you move faster.
[Lara finds Ana in one of the cathedral rooms. There is a tool scattered around, a winch hanging from above. A crowd of Trinity soldiers enters the room.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: It's got to be down there.

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Hurry up, Ander's waiting.

Speaker: Ana
Text: They found it?
[There are no options left and nowhere to hide. Lara runs up to Ana and takes her hostage with a gun to her head.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: Kill an unarmed woman? That would be cold even for you, Lara.
[Even more soldiers appear. Lara is surrounded by both the bottom and the top.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: Then again, I know why you haven't pulled that trigger. Shoot me and my men will cut you down within seconds. It's the one thing they're better at than you.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Shut up, Ana!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Don't move! You have nowhere to go!

Speaker: Ana
Text: Kill her! Now!
[Lara notices that her leg is caught in a generator cable. She shot the flammable barrels and the floor breaks down. Lara and Anna fly down, hitting the wooden bars with their backs.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: Those generators! They're going to pull us both down!
[Lara shoots at generators that act as a counterweight.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: Shit... Lara! Lara! I... I can't hold on! It's going to break!
[After destroying the generators, Lara falls to the floor below. Ana stays on the beam.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: Reconsider my offer, Lara... Before it's too late!

Speaker: Lara
Text: It was too late the moment you betrayed my family. I'm getting the Atlas, Ana!

Speaker: Ana
Text: Something is slaughtering my men down there, Lara! If they can't find it, neither can you.

Speaker: Lara
Text: Go to hell!
[She leaves.]

Speaker: Ana
Text: <via radio> Croft is on her way. Kill her and bring me that goddamned Atlas.
[Through a hole in the wall Lara sees a large, richly decorated staircase, on top of which stands a pedestal. There's something lying on the pedestal.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: That's it! It has to be...
[After so many misfortunes, Lara finally finds a place to start a fire and get some rest.]

Speaker: Lara’s Journal
Text: I'm ahead of Ana now, but I don't know what I've
[Having reloaded her weapons and rested Lara continues, lighting her way with a glowing stick.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: An old mural... and those vessels... Greek Fire.... The Prophet's Deathless army... Armed with Greek Fire, they were unstoppable…
[She walks into a narrow aisle filled with green gas. There are corpses hanging from the wall.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Augh.... that smell... Oh no.... Burned alive... Oh god!
[One of Trinity soldiers is alive. His skin is covered in ulcers, he barely moves. Lara is killing him out of pity.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Who could have done this? What the hell is that? These vessels... They're still filled with Greek Fire... I wonder if it will still burn…
[Of course they still explode. The whole aisle lights up with a bright flame and the floor collapses. Lara runs to the staircase.]
[Lara's approaching the pedestal.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: This is it.
[She raises a luminous polygon, decorated with different inscriptions. Suddenly a smoke grenade is flying under her feet.]

Speaker: Lara
Text: Trinity... they're here!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier
Text: Target acquired! Engage!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: The other fireteams aren't in position! Clear the gate, now!

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 3
Text: No time! We have to secure the objective before she

Speaker: Trinity Soldier 2
Text: Roger that. Thermite's through! Set the charges!
